body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27777#pullrequestreview-1450590109) |
| Stale ACK | [stickies-v](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27777#pullrequestreview-1451472783) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
This should fix the out-of-space error, see https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6118746146734080?logs=ci#L4903

Looks like it is working, but not claiming a lot of space:


https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6656469207089152?logs=ci#L408

```
Total reclaimed space: 949.4MB
Not sure what is going on. Seems there are unreachable zombie containers in the overlay2 directory. Let's try `podman` instead.

> Looks like it is working, but not claiming a lot of space:
> 
> [cirrus-ci.com/task/6656469207089152?logs=ci#L408](https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6656469207089152?logs=ci#L408)
> 
> ```
> Total reclaimed space: 949.4MB
> ```

What amount do you expect?

I already wiped all servers, but I was expecting that about 50GB of zombie stuff is cleared:


```
# du -sh /var/lib/docker/overlay2/ 
53G	/var/lib/docker/overlay2/

> Not sure what is going on. Seems there are unreachable zombie containers in the overlay2 directory. Let's try `podman` instead.

Maybe add:
```
docker volume prune --force
```
?
I listed all images, volumes, containers, networks, and the log file(s) and the list was empty, apart from 3 small image layers.
(CI is green, but it will probably take 6 months to find out if podman is running out of storage space as well)

> (CI is green, but it will probably take 6 months to find out if podman is running out of storage space as well)

Could explicit logging of disk space usage help in the meanwhile?
This is already done, see https://cirrus-ci.com/task/4965521926389760?logs=ci#L356

> This is already done, see [cirrus-ci.com/task/4965521926389760?logs=ci#L356](https://cirrus-ci.com/task/4965521926389760?logs=ci#L356)

Right. I mean, no need to wait for 6 month. If numbers are the same after a week then this PR works as intended, no?
Ok, I'll check back a week after merge.

Would it be prudent to use the [`--filter` option](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/image_prune/#filter) here to only prune images created by the CI? This may be especially helpful to people running the CI locally/unsandboxed. We'd just need to add a `--label "bitcoin-ci"` argument to `docker build`.

```suggestion
    docker image prune --force --filter label=bitcoin-ci
```
diff_hunk:
@@ -42,7 +42,9 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
 
   if [ -n "${RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN}" ] ; then
     echo "Restart docker before run to stop and clear all containers started with --rm"
-    systemctl restart docker
+    podman container kill --all  # Similar to "systemctl restart docker"
+    echo "Prune all dangling images"
+    docker image prune --force

body: Do dangling image (layer)s have a label? Anyway, this isn't for local runs, only for the persistent runners, guarded via `RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN`. Happy to rename `RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN` to `DANGER_RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN`?
diff_hunk:
@@ -42,7 +42,9 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
 
   if [ -n "${RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN}" ] ; then
     echo "Restart docker before run to stop and clear all containers started with --rm"
-    systemctl restart docker
+    podman container kill --all  # Similar to "systemctl restart docker"
+    echo "Prune all dangling images"
+    docker image prune --force

body: I'm not sure this works? Even though the CLIs have a compatible syntax, I think they operate on their own set of resources. I'm pretty sure `podman ps` right before this line won't show anything, so I think no containers are killed after this line? At least, that's what I get when I try locally spinning up a container with `docker run` and then try to show/kill it with `podman ps` or `podman container kill --all`.
diff_hunk:
@@ -42,7 +42,9 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
 
   if [ -n "${RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN}" ] ; then
     echo "Restart docker before run to stop and clear all containers started with --rm"
-    systemctl restart docker
+    podman container kill --all  # Similar to "systemctl restart docker"

body:
> Do dangling image (layer)s have a label?

Yeah they do, just tested it to confirm.

> guarded via RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN

Fair enough, looks like this is unlikely to be hit locally. I don't think renaming to `DANGER_RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN` is an improvement, so happy to keep as is. Just thought adding a label and only applying batch operations to our own images is a good practice, e.g. if in the future we remove the `RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN` condition, given that it's almost no overhead. But up to you, it's no big deal and I don't have a strong opinion.
diff_hunk:
@@ -42,7 +42,9 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
 
   if [ -n "${RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN}" ] ; then
     echo "Restart docker before run to stop and clear all containers started with --rm"
-    systemctl restart docker
+    podman container kill --all  # Similar to "systemctl restart docker"
+    echo "Prune all dangling images"
+    docker image prune --force

body: I already switched all machines to `podman-docker`, because it is not possible to install `docker.io` and `podman-docker` at the same time. So `docker run` is actually just an alias for `podman run`.
diff_hunk:
@@ -42,7 +42,9 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
 
   if [ -n "${RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN}" ] ; then
     echo "Restart docker before run to stop and clear all containers started with --rm"
-    systemctl restart docker
+    podman container kill --all  # Similar to "systemctl restart docker"

body: Ok, could make sense in a follow-up to apply the label to both places and then unguard the `image prune` from `DANGER_RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN`?
diff_hunk:

-    systemctl restart docker

+    echo "Prune all dangling images"
+    docker image prune --force

body: Okay, I can't comment on that. Since there is no mention of `podman` anywhere else in the codebase/documentation, I think this may make maintaining the CI more opaque, but perhaps that's an okay tradeoff.
diff_hunk:
@@ -42,7 +42,9 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
 
   if [ -n "${RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN}" ] ; then
     echo "Restart docker before run to stop and clear all containers started with --rm"
-    systemctl restart docker
+    podman container kill --all  # Similar to "systemctl restart docker"

body: Yeah, I don't expect anyone to use `RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN` beside the persistent workers, so it is an undocumented setting. Anyone using it is expected to infer the documentation from the two echo calls and two lines of code.
